intro: Deyeuxia australis, commonly known as the Australian flat sedge, is a perennial grass species native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and swampy areas. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged conditions. Deyeuxia australis plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
